Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: ANM42
Reviews.Content: Ordered 1 to check it out and now have 3 in total. Opening the Amazon box took longer than the actual set-up, which may have taken 60 seconds at most. Quick and easy. Like the motion alerts it sends to my phone/ipad. We have a vacation residence, so nice to keep an eye on it. We use in our main residence as well. I like the cloud recording as local storage doesn't make sense if you have a burglar who could easily steal/break the camera. Could the cost of the cloud recording be lower? Sure. But that will require a competitor to come up with a better product at a lower cost. Could happen. For now, I am a big fan of Dropcam.

Reviews.Title: BUSTED!!
Reviews.Author: Con
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Caught our nanny sleeping on all day when our 2 year old ran wild around the house. Which makes it well worth the price, however if it was more affordable we could have a couple around our house. Also, it does cut out at times but only last 3-20 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Motion Detection Needs Work
Reviews.Author: tyler durden
Reviews.Content: The video quality is very good, clear and crisp.Set up is a breeze, easier than 3 other WIFI cameras I own.The design is near perfect.Now the flaws- You cannot use the motion detection unless you want hundreds of false alerts a day. It will detect minimal shadow casts through windows. Mine seemingly sends alerts without any movement of anything, light included. I had to turn this feature off because I would get constant alerts, you can't trust it. I have a Piper as well and it has a much better motion detector, the downside to the Piper camera is that the lens is infrared so it cannot detect motion through windows. So if you want to point it outside it will not detect motion, even if you wave your hands directly into the camera. I thought Dropcam would cure this deficit but it fails for the opposite reason, it's too damn sensitive! I have read many reviews and forums and its a constant complaint, but I do not see the Dropcam heads responding to this concern. It's a major flaw for those looking for a security camera. Do not buy this if you need motion detection alerts.The fee for cloud service sucks, I don't know who would pay for for 24 hour cloud service. If I wanted to spend that kind of money I would just hire ADP to fit my house with their over priced service. In a world where we as consumers are getting nickel and dimed for everything, the last thing I want to sign up for is more cloud service, at least not at those prices.One of these companies has to get this niche market right, Dropcam came close but falls short like the others. Piper comes close as well, but the video quality is not as good as Dropcam. These are the top 2 WIFI cams, a few tweaks here and there and one of them could be top dog.

Reviews.Title: Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: techie-matt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit to keep an eye on my home while I am away. It has certainly given me peace of mind. I am not a subscriber of the monthly recording plan, as I believe it is too expensive for my purposes. Furthermore, I have paired my Dropcam with SmartThings. SmartThings recently provided integration into their platform with Dropcam to allow the capturing of images on the detection of motion or when sensors open and close. This integration is where I derive most of the value from the device, because I choose not to purchase a monthly plan from Dropcam. The image quality is pretty great for a webcam, but the device tends to be a bandwidth hog, so I choose to use the location features within the smartphone app to automatically turn the device off while I am at home (which doesn't work correctly very often and then requires manually opening the app and turning it off). If you are concerned with going over your monthly allowance with your internet service provider, this may not be the device for you (particularly if you need more than 1 device).I made the device 4 stars mainly because I believe the smartphone app can be significantly improved. The web interface allows you to zoom in and "enhance" video; however, the app does not. Therefore, if you have zoomed in on the web interface and forget to zoom back out before you log out, then in the app you are forced to view only that zoomed in portion of the recording until you zoom out on the web app. This can become increasingly frustrating as it has happened to me several times.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro..again.
Reviews.Author: MPG
Reviews.Content: The easy setup and use (with user friendly interface) on my first Dropcam Pro has caused me to return the Samsung Smartcam HD and order another Dropcam Pro. Yes, I know Dropcam forces you to use the cloud recording..and YES that is irritating..but..the quality and ease of use makes it worth it overall. Features like zoom to area for monitoring and disconnection alerts along with the EXCELLENT build quality have made me happy with this purchase..again.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: love it....especially the compatibility with the iPhone!  I would highly recommend this product.  it is easy to install, and is built like a quality product one would expect.

Reviews.Title: Simple Setup, Easy to Use Camera - Great Web & Smartphone App Experience!
Reviews.Author: DaveF
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera without doing much research as I needed it right away and I am blown away by the high quality and simplicity of the device. I bought the device to keep an eye on my dog during the work day and for a light security cam when I am away and would recommend it for anyone in a similar situation.When I opened the box, I was immediately struck by the level of detailing in the packaging. Everything was meticulously laid out and was a sign of things to come. Once I took out the camera, it was literally a 90 second setup. Plug the usb cable into the camera and the other end to your computer. Press the icon that appears on your desktop, create an account and you're literally done! It was as painless as you can get.Once setup you'll notice that the smartphone applications are well designed, has a bunch of advanced options and are very reliable. The quality of the video is awesome as it has an all glass lens. Low light video quality is also great and very usable. My favorite part of the smart phone app is it utilizes the phone's microphone to allow me to talk directly to my dog when she is misbehaving.If there was one thing I would change it would be the location of the micro usb port. It is a slightly difficult to get the end of the cable into the camera due to its location.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Chris J.
Reviews.Content: I own two of these camera's and they've performed flawlessly. I believe they are the best thing out there with there easy to use Cloud Service and I wouldn't think of buying anything else. I would buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: beckyncats
Reviews.Content: I wish I had thought of this sooner!!  This is a great camera-- I got it for my cats - to watch them while I was away. I can watch on my iphone. The product said that it could only be viewed on an iPad 3rd generation or higher but I can watch just fine on my iPad 2.  The audio works great. I was playing with it and talked to one of my cats while I was gone and she looked right at the camera.  I had read all the reviews of several items and chose this one and am glad I did!!

Reviews.Title: Downright Amazing
Reviews.Author: Dave Z. "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all I'm in IT -- so despite thoughts to the contrary, the last thing I want to do is to come home and play around with some difficult piece of unreliable technology.I'm happy to report, DropCam isn't on that list!I currently have an alarm system and pay extra to have video clips stored with my provider.  Their app to retrieve them is painfully slow and what I've found disappointingly is that on a regular basis the cameras either disconnect (and don't reconnect) or suffer some type of "burp" (yes, that's a technical term) when uploading their images to the provider.  On top of this the alarm co decided to design the clip to be 10 seconds after an event, so unless your Mr. Burglar is a charmer and when he trips the alarm is nice enough to stare steadily into the camera for a selfie your opportunity on getting a good pic is very limited.Not so with Dropcam.  Superb setup, easy user interface, very reliable and dependable.  I've had no disconnects that I can ascertain and when my internet service went down and came back up a few minutes later the camera cleanly reconnected.  My usage is limited to about 4 days to date but the image quality is spectacular, the wide angle lens really is great and the night vision is fine.  I don't have a problem paying $15/mo to get 7 days versus up video storage because I get 7 full days of storage and can go back and forth through a time span to watch an event (I just watched FedEx deliver to my house... and I'm at the office!  Apparently they delivered about 30 minutes ago and I was able to quite easily scroll through the timeline to find when the driver was on my porch).To help me from a security standpoint I connected an older Dell 9" Android Tablet up to the wall above my intercom and I run the dropcam app 24/7.  When someone rings my buzzer I have a nice video image of them and don't have to even ask who it is.Very happy with it, so much so that I just bought an additional one.

Reviews.Title: The best cam there is
Reviews.Author: Abu Faisal
Reviews.Content: The Camera met all my expectation and delivered exactly what the seller said about itTip:  Only Buy HD if you have Cable, Fiber, or VDSL.  If you have normal ADSL line, don't buy the HD because you will not benefit from its capability

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY an essential part of security for a small business!
Reviews.Author: sjb7bf
Reviews.Content: Wow! What is not to love about Dropcam? We purchased this camera to keep tabs on what goes on inside our small business while we are away and have not been disappointed. The set up was a breeze, we are moderately tech savvy (but definitely no experts). The directions were easy to read and follow. We received 10 day free trial of the cloud service, which stores video so you can review it later, you can also save specific clips of video. This product is so well priced for the amount of peace of mind it can give a small business owner. We did purchase the cloud storage after our trial was up and have since set up notifications for after hours, so we can be notified when unusual activity happens and it is great to see the happenings in our business when we are away. Would absolutely recommend this to anyone, especially small business owners.

Reviews.Title: Wow! This thing is great! So glad I bought it I'm buying another.
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: I just bought a dropcam pro at the apple store. I tend not to be a returner and I was feeling badly about returning a Vuepro Camera that I'd bought from amazon (don't buy the Vuepro) and I didn't want to risk buying the dropcam and returning it too. It's my nature to not be wasteful. Anyhoo, I brought the dopcam pro home and had it set up in my den in under fifteen minutes. The picture quality is great, I'm not getting any of the freezing that some have complained about and the hesitation in audio is very slight. I'm going to buy at least one more dropcam pro and get the cloud service for both. The service for a week's worth of recording to the cloud is $99. for one camera and for a second camera it's half price, so once you've bought two of these cameras for $400., cloud service is $150. a year for both cameras. You can't beat that!Listen: I set the camera up in my den not far from my African Grey Parrot's cage and went in to my office on the other side of the house to see how things looked. Clear as a bell. I wanted to check out the audio so I said my parrot's name to my Mac's monitor. I said "Morgan?" After a little hesitation I heard "Carl?" Hah! Smart bird and smart owner to have bought this camera. I'll buy the next one from amazon to make that returned Vuepro up to them.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro: Excellent Image Quality; Very Reliable!
Reviews.Author: Russ
Reviews.Content: Our Dropcam Pro has been a terrific addition to our household.  The image quality is excellent, even in low light conditions, and it maintains its wireless connection continually and completely reliably.  The cloud video recording ("CVR") is exceptionally convenient (we have the 7-day storage plan); and both the CVR and the Dropcam image can be accessed remotely, as can be the camera's settings & controls.  The camera's built-in microphone's sensativity can be adjusted, and I have found the quality of the recorded sounds to be quite good as well, just as the camera's image is.  One can also set the camera to send alerts to an email address should it detect sound, motion or any other unrecognized activity.  It is a snap to set up and takes literally only a minute or two to set up and to have it up and running.  The camera does *not* require any ongoing connections to a computer (a computer is only reqired for the intitial setup, and then is not required after that).  Furthermore, in my view, not having to keep a computer up and running to use the camera or to capture video locally is a huge advantage.  For example, one could live in the northeast, yet maintain a camera remotely installed at another location, say, in Florida.  Not needing to maintain a connection to a computer to use the Dropcam eliminates any concerns about potential power failures & the related computer reboots, etc. at the [remote] camera's location.  Finally, Dropcam's customer service is exemplary; representatives are polite, knowledgeable and professional.  In short, I highly recommend Dropcam Pro for your video monitoring needs.

Reviews.Title: Great little security Camera
Reviews.Author: The Jersey Family
Reviews.Content: The camera did exactly what I wanted it to do.  In fact I bought two.  I have one facing the street and one facing the back of my home.  It send alerts when somebody comes onto the property.  I wish there was a way to hook it up to your own DVR or computer.  If you want to save footage, you have to subscribe to their service.  It's not a crazy price, but I was hoping for a better deal when I subscribed to with both cameras..  I would buy more, but the annual fee it too much.  But the product works great and it's a very easy install.  If you just want to monitor the cameras there is no cost.

Reviews.Title: Great Product - wonderful customer service!
Reviews.Author: Jerry Kincaid
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Dropcam Pro in November 2013.  The high resolution and wide-angle image that the Dropcam Pro provides is excellent.  Sound quality is clear and easy to understand.  Setup took less than one minute, as advertised.  After a few months, my camera periodically (and seemingly at random) dropped the network connection.  I experimented with it for a day with no success, then contacted Dropcam customer support.  They requested some basic information that I could quickly provide, then offered to exchange the unit.  Within two days a brand new Dropcam Pro arrived at my front door.  It works perfectly.I shipped the defective unit back to customer support folks, using a prepaid Fedex label provided by Dropcam.  This was great service and I am a huge fan of Dropcam Pro.

Reviews.Title: Perfect solution for your average home!
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure which camera to get because quite frankly the reviews so mixed for both the Belkin HD with Night Vision and the DropCam Pro.My use for the cameras is to keep an eye on my pets while not at home, as well as the dog-walker to takes care of them while I am out. I set the Belkin up in my kitchen to view anyone coming in the door and the DropCam upstairs to keep an eye on the dogs.First issue with this Belkin. I literally get over FIFTY motion detection emails a day, at that is a low estimage. There is NO ONE in my house and no movement shown on the tiny screenshots sent to my email. Secondly, there is no notification from the app. So if I have the email settings on my phone turned off, I do not get an alert with sound, which considering the number of false alarms, is probably a good thing. Then the email itself, just shows a screenshot of the (non-motion) versus a live feed (more on that in a second). Using the app, to view any clips that may have been taken if there was actual movement requires a subscription to Belink for their cloud service, which I don't think I really need at this point. My last issue is that for some reason the view on my phone shows on the display vertically so I have to turn my phone to view the screen correctly, which is really just an annoyance.Had I not also purchased the DropCam Pro, most of these things might not bother me as much. But with that, the downloaded app alerts me to real movement, so I can actually go into the camera app and view a live feed or any activities that may have recently happened if I missed them (with pretty good sound). You can purchase the cloud also, but I just want to make sure things are good with my dogs here and there, not really storing any data long term. I also get an email with the same thing, but the link through the app is perfect. I don't get any false alarms and the picture/sound I find much better. The only downside to this device, is that you do need a computer/laptop at this point to do the initial set-up, but like the Belkin it was pretty easy.I am not a tech/gadet person and I really wanted to like the less expensive product. However, after using both cameras for a few days, I will be purchasing an additional DropCam and returning the Belkin. It is well worth the money for the quality and convenience, especially the WAY better app for Android.

Reviews.Title: Not bad. This is Apple-like device. High quality everything.
Reviews.Author: Vijay Jegan
Reviews.Content: We are using this as a baby monitor for now (new born).  Eventually, I'll install it as a security device. The reason for only 4 stars is when my wife and I freaked out once. Here is what happened:One evening, we put our baby down upstairs (while he was tired but mostly awake) and then my wife and I came downstairs. We setup our iPhone to view the baby in real-time with sound. We could hear the baby making some minor noise here and there while we were watching TV. Then, after few minutes, my wife took a closer look to see if he is asleep since it was quiet. And what she saw scared the hell out of us. We can clearly see the babies' eyes are open, staring almost at the camera, but NOT MOVING one bit. We turned up the sound, kept watching for another 20 seconds. ABSOLUTELY no sound (but we know the mic is on since we hear the slight hiss), and NO movement while he's looking at the camera with his eyes open. Yeah, you can imagine our reaction. I ran like hell up the stairs, stormed into his room and immediately picked him up. His eyes were closed and clearly he was asleep. I woke him a bit just to make sure. Then, I slowly put him down again and went downstairs. My wife was watching the camera the whole time still frozen with the baby's eyes open. We immediately knew that although sound was live the picture clearly froze. I had to turn the camera on and off again few times to make work again properly.So, it definitely left a scar in our memory. It's because of the "live" hiss sound, we just thought camera is recording live. Anyway, I have over 50megs down and 10 up. So, I have plenty of bandwidth and my wireless signal is outstanding since Airport Extreme is not that far away and I have Airport Express repeating the signal elsewhere to get a solid coverage. In any case, we still like the product but I am still trying to shake the adrenaline from the whole thing. :)

Reviews.Title: Really worth the cost!
Reviews.Author: Taterbug "Tbug"
Reviews.Content: I received a DropCam Pro for Christmas this past year and all I can say is it truthfully is easy to set up and very clear and has some great uses that only the user can decide what's best for them. Streaming the video is not a problem and keep in mind your upload speed is more important with these cams because obviously you are uploading your cam signal and stream to their servers. (Truthfully it takes a small amount of uploading bandwidth so don't get worried it won't work)I have recently wanted to use this camera in other areas of my home or more importantly outside but you are limited to being connected to a power supply. Normally you would use the electric adapter and the Micro UBS cable provided but what if you wanted it outside on your porch or somewhere there was no electric but you still was in range of you WIFI??  I solved that problem for a temporary fix by buying a portable battery that you use to charge ipads, iphones or any USB chargeable device. I purchased a Anker® Astro E5 15000mAh Dual USB Portable Charger from Amazon that works really great and lasts a long time powering the camera on a full charge. The charge operated the cam for exactly 27 hours and 48 minutes.  Not bad for a charge but I realize also you might want the cam to operate for longer than a day. I guess outside of running electric to the cam you could have 2 or more batteries charged and interchange them out when it is depleted.  I know it's not ideal but it works and works great. Also I seen an article on how to make the DropCam more weather proof and I am posting it. It's not necessarily a good idea because DropCam states in would void warranty however read the article and comments and make your own decision ... I'm looking forward to trying it myself but I do intend for my weather to get better and more predictable before I try.[...]

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased our second Dropcam Pro. We have had some issues with neighborhood vandalism and to have our security company install an exterior camera would have cost $350/camera plus a $20/month increase in monitoring fees. After reading some earlier reviews of some folks monitoring outside activities by pointing the camera out through a window we decided it was worth a try. Worked perfectly so we purchased the second camera. The cloud recording and the ability to review activity from any device are  great features and well worth the extra cost. Customer support has been outstanding. I highly recommend this camera and this company.

Reviews.Title: Love this but beware
Reviews.Author: copperheadharley
Reviews.Content: Do not buy these cameras from Dropcam.  I purchased two of the cheaper version and both were apparently returned from someone else since the cameras were scratched.  Got two replacements and same thing on one of the two.  So out of four cameras, three were not new products in my opinion.  The seal on the boxes were broken on three of the four so that gives some indication.  Returned them all to Dropcam and bought from Amazon.  Perfect condition with box seal intact.  The Pro has an all glass lense and the clarity is really impressive.  Setup takes 2 minutes or less.  Field of view is awesome.  I can't view on my laptop macbook pro because I refuse to download Adobe and my iPad is too old to download the new Dropcam app so for now I can only view the camera on my iPhone 5 which is good enough.  Did not buy the iCloud recording option.  It anyone breaks in, I can always take snapshots of my iPhone screen to identify the thieves!  For anyone that does not know how to do this - you hit the home button and on/off button at the same time and it takes a picture of whatever is showing on your phone at that time.  Also, 8x zoom is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: kathleen connolly
Reviews.Content: If you are considering a wireless camera for your home I would recommend the Dropcam Pro. It was very easy to set up with beautiful resolution. I am so pleased, I just purchased a second. K. C.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Hyland Lyle
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to set up. The picture quality is very good in daylight and fair at night. Does not work well through a window at night but fine in daylight. The on line recorder is great for $100 yr. the IPhone app works very well.Wish dropcam made an outdoor camera.I would recommend this to a friend that was looking for an indoor camera for close range (100' or less) that can give you a good pic that you could see who it is in your home.The zoom pic is nice but as you zoom the res falls off quickly.

Reviews.Title: Two was not enough
Reviews.Author: Rita Schroeder
Reviews.Content: We are so pleased with the drop cam that we bought a third one for the California house for when we are gone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Tillman
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the best wifi camera that I've had the privilege to operate.  One flaw in my opinion.  When the room is warm, the camera heats up pretty hot.  Unfortunately, when the camera is hot, you start getting delays (sometimes up to 10 minutes).  As a work around, I usually unplug the camera almost once a day from the power source to let it cool down.  To reconnect, you just simple replug it in the power source.

Reviews.Title: This is my second dropcam
Reviews.Author: Derek Grafton
Reviews.Content: As noted above this is my second dropcam. My first was the 2nd generation drop cam which we use as a security camera to watch over our property while we were on vacation. My original camera texted me that it detected motion/sound causing me to "tune into" the camera via my iPhone app. I quickly discovered someone was trying to break into my house by smashing in the front door!!! I obviously quickly called the police and notified my trusty neighbor living down the street. Fortunately the thief never made it inside. My friend arrived at the house less then five minutes later probably causing the thief to give up and run away. Unfortunately I was unable to identify the perpetrator via the video (I sent the video clip to local law enforcement). Subsequently, this led to me to purchase an additional camera; the Dropcam Pro. I have now mounted this camera to watch the front door. I am confident if they come back I will be able to identify them. I am amazed at the improved video and sound quality.The only downside to the cameras so far are a few delays in alert notification. This is intermittent and hopefully just a software issue. I would definitely recommend spending the extra $50 or so to get this latest camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Baby Monitor and security camera
Reviews.Author: amzUSR
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised and then some.  Has been very reliable, just make sure you have a reliable wifi network at your location.  Has a very wide-angle lense so if you are using it for a baby monitor you may have to place it pretty close to the subject.  Works great on IPAD and IPHONE.  If you are using it via web browser you may get that spinning icon (as if it's trying to load the image) - however, I found out it was my firewall blocking certain ports.  Opened up outbound tcp and spinning icon is now gone.

Reviews.Title: Agreement with other reviewers
Reviews.Author: Milo
Reviews.Content: Just like others have reported - extremely easy to set up and your account for just streaming.  Less than 90 seconds to do it.  I purchased this to see what my dog is up to during the day, which is mostly sleeping and barking at occasional squirrels.  I have it mounted inside the house on a window sill looking out at the dog run with night vision "off" .When these folks develop an outdoor camera, I will buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great Improvement!
Reviews.Author: frederick eckert
Reviews.Content: This Pro version is much better in quality of video and field of view than the original ones, which are still good to have!

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup with an excellent view.
Reviews.Author: Bico
Reviews.Content: This camera was really easy to setup.  I had it up and running with a couple of minutes of taking it out of the box.  I was able to use an iphone it set it so no need to plug it into the computer.  If you was wondering about the picture quality, you can go to dropcam.com and see web cameras that other people have made public.  Just make sure to check which your are looking at the pro version as they also have a non-pro version that isn't as good. One thing to watch out for if you are on a limited data plan is that this camera is HD and as such uses a decent amount of data to upload from the camera and to view the data feed.  You can turn the camera off and on remotely which should help if data is an issues.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: gt
Reviews.Content: I've purchased 2 HD Dropcams (recent $149 models) and 1 Dropcam Pro.Likes:Setup is quick and easy.Cloud archiving works great.Video quality is good for the HD Dropcams but is excellent with the Dropcam Pro.The Pro has much improved low light capability.I use and like the 5 GHz Wi-Fi capability.Dislikes:The audio volume is significantly weaker on the Pro model.Things I'd like to see in the future:An outdoor version with a Ethernet port option.Optical zoom or digital zoom without loss of video quality.

Reviews.Title: Awesome security system
Reviews.Author: Texas Reader
Reviews.Content: Bought one, loved, so bought another. Streams to the cloud, so a burglar can't steal your video. There are some minor drawbacks----you can only get alerts every thirty minutes, the jpegs you receive by email should be bigger and sharper, and you can adjust the sensitivity of the motion detection---but despite those shortcomings, I still love this product.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Bob Snyder
Reviews.Content: Quality product is easy to install and get up and running. Daylight pictures are excellent nighttime pictures need added light, using a light with the motion sensor to solve the problem.Customer service on the phone and by email is excellent. I can understand the person I'm talking to.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great product, wish I didn't have to pay to save
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I received this as a birthday gift and have only been using it a few days. I had two primary reasons; determine which of my dogs was destroying everything every time we left the house, and for babysitter monitoring in the near future.Well we had the perfect chance to test it out yesterday. After having been gone from home for about 30 minutes, we checked the camera to see the "planted" newspaper strewn about the room. We backed up to the previous activity markers (there are markers to show when there was activity you would want to view) to see our one dog destroying the paper while the other one growled and barked at him from the couch the entire time. We're pretty sure she was trying to tell him to stop because she never growls and barks at him unless he's trying to stand on her, and he was no where near her. It was fantastic because we knew not to scold her when we got home since she had nothing to do with it.The quality is great, but it does get a little grainy when you zoom in. No big deal though, how close do you need to get? It picks up sound really well; we could even hear her low growls before she picked up her head and she was all the way on the other side of the room from where the camera was placed. The night vision works really well too. I've checked in on the living room from my bedroom once to check on a noise (so much safer than walking out there if there were to be a burglar or something!) and everything was crystal clear, just black and white.It's also awesome that you can talk to whoever you're watching. I logged into the phone app (which is free) the other night and was talking to the dogs. One of them got up and started licking and sniffing the camera (and it didn't leave any gross smudges blocking my view).The ONLY thing I don't like, is that the CRV (recording, saving, and watching previous footage feature) is only available if you pay. It's a little expensive; $10 a month or $99 a year for 7 days of saved, or $30 a month or $300 a year for 30 days of saved.I'd really like to get the CVR option, which we have a free trial of right now, because it's a big part of the usefulness of this product, but that's just a little expensive. I wish it were a little cheaper, otherwise it's a great product and it has been incredibly useful already.

Reviews.Title: does not work with iPad only works with a computer, beautiful picture, great night vision, wide angle lens  indoor use only
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Bad:The camera does not work well with an IPad. When viewing on the Ipad it constantly freezes up.Pretty much the camera will only work with a computer.Customer service (1-877-345-3767) is excellent. They will go out of their way to help you.2 way talk works but there is about a 10 second delay.Good:fast setup, wireless, only need a routerBeautiful colorful picture (HD 1080p digital zoom), clear and shows colors great.Night vision picture works great. The picture looks like a black and white and bright even in a pitch dark room.The mount to hang the camera is good.Wide lensdigital zoom works great

Reviews.Title: excellent product Highly recommend
Reviews.Author: ALLAN SOLIS SOLIS
Reviews.Content: just two days with this camera and is awesome, if you want a camera for any place you must to buy this. Just the CRV is a little expensie, and can't save video directly to my computer. but is excellent product

Reviews.Title: Quick & Easy Setup- Good Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: MelLuvsCharlie
Reviews.Content: We are using this Dropcam Pro as first time baby cam users. Out of the box It took about 10 minutes to have up and streaming. Super easy. The power cord is pretty long which I appreciate. We put the camera near the ceiling and there was still some slack. It will have to be stapled to the baseboard to keep it from dangling. The setup is minimal, username, password, find wifi, that's it. The picture quality is pretty good. It isn't sharp/clear like digital video camera recording. But, it is a pretty good streaming quality. It adjusts the lighting making up for dim rooms. Looks brighter/lighter in the stream.  The only real negative for me is the zoom. The zoom isn't like a real zoom. You zoom in a digital zoom way...like when zooming in on a picture on your digital camera. So, it shows the pixels after about 4x. But you can get to 8x and get an idea of what is going on in less detail.  Hopefully if the wifi is better it will get clearer. For what I need with my baby, it is perfect. It can view the whole room. We may mount it to the wall directly about the crib so that the crib can be the focal point and less of the surroundings take up space. So far I have had a 3-4 second delay which I don't think is too bad. It definitely isn't "live" live.  Although, I noticed that on my laptop the delay is slightly less than on my iPad app. I get alerts on my phone when there is movement or noise. A little clip is included in the email alert so you can view what just happened. I suppose you need the cvr plan to get the clips. I'm still in the 14 day free trial. Otherwise, the emails direct you to view live which is free. The cvr recording option isn't a real problem for us. Regular baby monitors don't have the option to record so the fact that I have to pay a bit doesn't bother me. Of course free would be great but the fee is ok. We can create and share clips which is pretty cool. The talk feature is ok. But, it's like talking through a walkie talkie.  You can't both talk at the same time if one parent is in the room and the other is somewhere else streaming. But, it works.  If I talk to my baby through that it won't matter.  I really like it so far. My husband can view the baby and talk to him from work during the day.  I will update in a month or so to see if my feelings changed.

Reviews.Title: Uses 60gb of monthly internet!
Reviews.Author: A. Boran
Reviews.Content: I own one foscam and an old panasonic, so wanted add another cam and went for dropcam PRO. On the pro side: the field of view is wider and device is smaller, BUT this little thing consumes 60gb of internet a month. So unless you like live video broadcasting this is very costly. Also pic quality is not better when you zoom, worse than foscam and panasonic.I contacted their support team several times to ask if they can improve on the data usage by either reducing frame rate or by setting up the alert system so that it only goes live when there is an alert. The answer to both these questions was negative. So thinking about returning now.I am sure other companies like samsung, foscam and panasonic that will improve theirs so soon we will hopefully get something that addresses these key issues. I actually quite liked Foscam except its quite bulky and doesnt have wide field of view like dropcam.Hope this is useful to those looking to buy an ip cam.

Reviews.Title: Everything it promises
Reviews.Author: Bdubzz77
Reviews.Content: Great product. Exactly what I wanted for security and peace of mind. Streaming to the cloud and privacy was a big concern but I just set the cameras to turn on when I leave and off when I get home. Someone can watch video of my empty house all they want. Just get a random password generator and set ur dropcam and wifi account to different long passwords.  I think everything works great on this cam...mic, zoom, the wide angle lens, the simplicity of the apps. Couldn't be easier

Reviews.Title: Great buy....works great
Reviews.Author: John Kraus
Reviews.Content: I'm 65 years old and this item was very easy to set up ....as advertised. Use my iPad. Clear picture

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Works Great when it Works
Reviews.Author: Mickey 3 Gun "M3Gn"
Reviews.Content: Seems to drop sync frequently.  (With the router within 15 feet of the camera no less.)  Appears to have a 30 sec delay from real-time, which considering, is great.  It's a little pricey, but having it store images in the cloud is a plus, (but at $9.99 a month).  Image quality is not HD but you can, when using the "Enhancement" mode, have a usable image at the higher digital zoom settings.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro
Reviews.Author: dianne rushing
Reviews.Content: I like it but wish it had a fast forward option.  It certainly is easy to use.  I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I feel a lot safer after installing this in my home, I also signed up for the 7 day CVR (Cloud Video Recording) which lets me watch everything that's happened in the past 7 days.-Set up was a breeze. I just placed the camera where I wanted it and followed the instructions on my iPhone.-Video quality is amazing and I experienced very little delay while watching myself on my phone.-I had problems with the 2 way audio function. It worked perfectly with my Nexus 4 running Android, but I couldn't get it to work with my iPhone running iOS 7 or my iPad. Hopefully a software update will be released in the near future.-Then there's the part that I do not like.. And that is bandwidth. Comcast is my Internet provider, and they cap all residential users at 300GB per month here in Atlanta, GA.This last month, 60GBs were utilized by Dropcam. 60GBs isn't so bad, but the thing is, I want to purchase another cam in the future. So I'm looking at 120GBs for two cameras.If I ever wish to buy a 3rd cam, I will only have about 100GBs left to use for myself. If you use Netflix or watch videos on Amazon, you will burn through the 100GBs very quickly.Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase, I wish I could do something about the data usage, but unfortunately I can't. The only solution is to switch from a residential to a business Internet service, which costs nearly 3 times more.

Reviews.Title: I use five Dropcams at my restaurant
Reviews.Author: leecrowell
Reviews.Content: Alert! Read update at the end of this review.I started using Dropcam in September after a theft at my restaurant, Dale's Café. Tried one and then quickly added two more after I saw the ease of use and ease of installation and after I tried a Foscam which was tedious to install and did not include a built in monitor which their ad claimed is included. Three Dropcams had me protected from any more thefts, but in a few weeks I wanted two more in order to monitor my dining areas. Well, lo and behold a surprise package came with a Dropcam Pro inside. It was a gift from Dropcam because I had given them a good review on the first three and also shared with them a design I came up with for a very secure mounting plate which is necessary in a busy environment like our restaurant. I then purchased a second Dropcam Pro and just finished installation of both cameras today. I apologize to Dropcam that it's taken me a couple of months since I first received their gift until today's install, but I promised them I would give a review and I can feel like it's unbiased because it's finished on my timetable according to the needs of my business.The Dropcam Pro has every feature of a regular Dropcam and it has better definition and a wider view. This is good for my situation because the Pros are covering a larger area in the dining rooms and the regular Dropcams are in a closer range because the kitchen areas are smaller.  My large dining area is 23' by 25' and my large kitchen is 12' by 18'. I am very satisfied with the visual quality on all my cameras and they perform better than I need them to.  I don't use the audio on any of my cameras but I did with my first Dropcam and it worked great. Then I found out that it is possibly illegal to record audio in public places so I shut off audio on all my cameras.The main reason I like Dropcam and Dropcam Pro is the way they record on Dropcam's website (they call it a cloud). I use their seven day recording cycle and for five cameras it costs me thirty dollars a month. A thief can come in and grab my cameras but he can't steal the recording of his theft. If I had a camera system on a DVR and a thief stole it I would lose the entire recording but with Dropcam I have the security of knowing I have a recording of the thief up to the moment he takes my camera. Accessing my cameras on Dropcam's website is as easy as accessing my email or checking my bank account. I can access my cameras anywhere there is internet access.The only possible downside of using Dropcam versus an in house system is the need for wireless internet access and the monthly cost if you need storage of your recordings. But for my purpose of securing my business I think it's money well spent. If you want to monitor a place where there is no internet access you are SOL, or to be less cryptic it just won't work. For my setup with five cameras I my internet provider gives me 10 mbps of download and 2mpbs of upload. Dropcam's technician recommends 0.5 mbps of upload per camera if you use audio (the cameras don't use download). But because I don't use audio the 2 mbps of upload is more than enough for five cameras. I tested my connection with all cameras on and was still showing 1.29 mbps of upload available which indicates I could probably add five more cameras and still have plenty of bandwidth to support them.I said it in my first review and still feel the same way, Dropcam's system of recording on their internet site is superior to in-house recording and I believe they lead the future of the video surveillance industry. They also have a great support staff and I haven't been left on hold for more than a couple of minutes.If you email any questions to me I will respond but I don't use email on a daily basis so it may take some time.Update 01-08-14 Having used all five cameras for 6 days I've experienced some intermittent down time occasionally on individual cameras and spoke with Dropcam support. They want me to increase my upload bandwidth to a minimum of 0.5 mpbs per camera which means I will need 2.5 mpbs upload for my five cameras. This increase takes place today and I will report back with results.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: MJC
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this camera; I read the reviews, including the concerns, but thought I'd give it a try.  Could not be happier.  Great audio and video (note-- only black and white); I'm doing the "trial" video storage and may pony up for it.  I travel, and having this camera on my dogs is a blessing. It allows me to see how my dog sitter is doing, too (does not know the camera is there). I love being able to speak to my dogs.  I get alerts on my iPhone/iPad for either sound/movement, and that has been a great value.  The night vision works perfectly. Truly, no complaints. Yes, you can shut off the "alerts," too.  Will likely buy another camera for a different portion of my home and will connect the two.  My daughter (in another state) occasionally checks in and we can chat using the camera (note, there is a min delay in audio interaction).

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro
Reviews.Author: Donna & Scott
Reviews.Content: Bought this to keep an "eye" on the house during an extended vacation. Easy set-up, easy to use on my mobile device, worked no matter where we were at in the UK. Wish the price was a little lower, would buy one more.

Reviews.Title: Jury still out !
Reviews.Author: joemamma
Reviews.Content: While i seem to have some of the same issues others have ,i have to admit the clarity of the camera is very good...i'll just have to decide if i can live with these issues as they are intermittent. Meanwhile my latest issue is that since Sprint downloaded new software a couple of weeks ago , i have been unable to access my camera via 3g on my Galaxy 3 and difficulty at times thru wireless when i'm  out.  I have talked to customer service about this issue and other issues and they tell me they are working on this problem as they are aware of it. However since most of the times i'm out and about i need the security of knowing my camera can alert me and that don't happen driving down the street unless you are on 3g....hence , i don't really have a security camera now. While i admit the camera is nice i've noticed you have to be moving very slow or standing still to be able to clearly see the persons face,....of course, light condtions play a big role in this. Customer service seems to be well trained and polite albeit sometimes scripted so i'll give it a tad bit longer to fix my problem and at that time i'll have no problem updating my rating to four stars ....and if necessary  down grading to two stars.

Reviews.Title: Not really intended for windows users
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This product worked great- setting up (using my MacBook Pro) was so easy- and the app available for the iPhone and iPad worked great- however- I bought this for someone who is a Windows User- both computer/tablet and windows phone-  so none of the awesome stuff that worked for me when I set it up for them- would work with his windows phone- so wouldn't recommend this product to a Windows users (as you don't get the alerts or motion notification, etc.,) as I mentioned it worked for me when testing with my iPhone but won't work the same on a Windows device-

Reviews.Title: Dropcam is a must have as a secondary security system!
Reviews.Author: Rommel Ladiao
Reviews.Content: I purchased my dropcam on black friday.  Initially, I purchased dropcam as a monitoring system for my dog.  I am very pleased with its app/camera system.  On Christmas eve, my wife and i were celebrating w/ family in another city.  Unfortunately, we came home and our house was burglarized.  Our hearts dropped when we saw the thieves took all our electronics, laptops, and safe!  We were hoping the dropcam would catch the perps, but realized our trial period had expired.  After contacting dropcam, they were so kind and generous to give us 6 months of complimentary cvr service.  This shed light on a dark time and we are grateful for Dropcam's generosity.  If you cannot afford a full blown security system, Dropcam is a great alternative.  The camera's location deterred the perps from stealing within that room.  Once again, I highly recommend dropcam.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam, easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: Dennis Rehfuss
Reviews.Content: Quick easy setup. Only improvement I can think of would be to add a time and date to the screen when saving photos.

Reviews.Title: we upgraded our HD for the Pro model
Reviews.Author: M Bret Blackford
Reviews.Content: We recently replaced 4 of the older HD cameras with the new Pro model.  The wider angle is helpful and there does seem to be better resolution. However, the mic on the Pro is much weaker than on the previous model HD.  I need to crank my speaker way up to hear what is going on. Also, I notice more connection issues with the Pro model, especially when the camera senses a lot of movement or at dusk/dawn when the camera is trying to decide what to do about night vision.Overall I am pleased with the camera and hope Dropcam continues to refine the software.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for a affordable cctv with online dvr.  Need cheap security at your home or business?  This is for you!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!!! For as small as it is, it has really good quality.  The online dvr is great, alerts you when it detects movement.  There is so many uses for it. Catch your wife cheating, find out what cat is doing work in your garden, or why FedEx keeps breaking everything they deliver! Great purchase here!

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro!
Reviews.Author: Rdillon3496
Reviews.Content: I've been using your product for about 3weeks now. It has been awesome. The alerts to movement is helpful. It is reassuring to see the quality is great. I have mine set to turn on and off when I come and go. And I'm surprised to see how many cats, opossum and raccoons are in my area. Although the phone app is easy and convenient, the web service has more features that I'd like to see in the app. That would be my only complaint, even though it a minor one.Thanks for the peace of mind DropCam!

Reviews.Title: Use it as a security system too!
Reviews.Author: Austin Guy 2005
Reviews.Content: This is awesome! I love how it's HD and does push notifications to your phone (so you can set it up to notify you when it sees something or hears something which pretty much makes it a monitored security system)!PROS:HDApp works great so you get notified for movement / sound as soon as it happensWifi has a long rangeCONS:It does detect movement when there is none (which is minorly annoying when trying to use it as a security feature)

Reviews.Title: Best camera out there!
Reviews.Author: lawmangm
Reviews.Content: So, let me start off by saying...I've tried them all!!!  From wired cameras to wireless cameras, I have tested each camera to its fullest.  My goal is to fully automate my home, and along the way, I found Dropcam!  Simply put, this is the BEST camera out there!!! It's simple to set up (5 minutes max), the picture quality is amazing, and it's reliable.My last point is the most important to me.  Many of other products I used were just simply unreliable.  They would go "offline" often and rendered the device unusable.  Dropcam is the most consistent and has only gone offline when my router decides to stop!  The sound is amazing and the two-way communication is mind blowing!  Don't even get me started on how useful night vision is!  Couple it with the camera quality and you've got an impressive nightly view!For anyone out there looking for something amazing...Dropcam is it!  I have 3 now, and am looking to add up to 2 more.  Simply put: this is a must have in any house or business!  Enjoy as much as I have!!!

Reviews.Title: Finally....a solution that works !!!
Reviews.Author: L C "flingwing warrior"
Reviews.Content: Well I've been a die-hard tech-geek for the past 35 years. One of those dummies they call "early adopters" so I've ended up spending money on a lot of products that never quite live up to the hype. Security cameras are one of those items. Over the last two years, I've spent $400 to $500 on security camera gear that would (1) Allow me to view my home in real time from anywhere in the world (2) Alert me via text or email if there was motion or abnormal sound in the house and (3) Document in video or photos what caused the alert and to automatically "push" the collected data into an off-site storage area. The other devices that I purchased would not do all of those things but I accepted the compromises that I had to make. Unfortunately, reliability was also an issue with the other products.Two weeks ago I read a couple of reviews on the new Dropcam Pro and it seemed like a dream come true. I ordered one from Amazon and received it today. As advertised, I had it up and running in 5 minutes after I downloaded the iPhone app. No need to fiddle with router settings, firewalls or anything. The video is excellent even in my dimly lit living room. The wide-angle view is perfect and the zoom works well. Motion/Sound detection works well. There are many other features that can be turned on and off so I recommend that you go to the manufacturer's web site and check them out. I played with all of them today and they all work as well as their claims. The unit comes with a free 14 day trial period for the feature that stores 7 days of video on the companies cloud server. Very cool. You can go there from the phone app or from any web browser and scroll back through the history. Any disturbances due to sound or motion show up on the time line as "blips" so that you can go directly to those parts of the video. From there, you can set a start and end point and save the video/audio clip. Once done, you can even download it.The Dropcam folks charge $99 per year for this cloud service but that seems like a bargain for this kind of peace of mind. We live in a rural area and there have been lots of break-ins the last couple of years. My wife and I have been traveling a lot since we retired five years ago. I had a basic ADT system installed but by the time law enforcement could respond, my "stuff" would be long gone. This camera would at least give us some evidence to help the police catch the thieves and maybe even recover our belongings.Further details are on the manufacturer's web site. All features work well and exceeded my expectations. I will probably order a second camera for my family room area. Dropcam only charges an additional $50 per year for the cloud service for a second camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but no local streaming over WiFi/LAN
Reviews.Author: Hans T Sy Jr
Reviews.Content: Let's make it really clear.IF YOU HAVE LOUSY/BAD INTERNET... THIS IS NOT THE PRODUCT YOU SHOULD BE BUYING!I unfortunately have the displeasure of having to live with really bad internet service at the moment. So imagine my surprise when my new awesome Dropcam Pro was sending me the laggiest video clips I have ever seen in a long while.Which is a real shame because the image quality is really good on this product.  Product setup was also straightforward, not really needing a lot of know how to do.Anyways, just wanted to warn people who needed a camera for local streaming, THIS IS NOT THE PRODUCT YOU WANT!

Reviews.Title: Works well but required a computer for me to set it up
Reviews.Author: Jerry Heald
Reviews.Content: This web cam works well but requires a computer to get it set up. By contrast, the Belkin Netcam can be set up with a free app on my android smartphone.

Reviews.Title: An upgrader's view: From the previous gen HD  to Pro.
Reviews.Author: RST10
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these-- one as a replacement and one as a spare, to upgrade the previous generation Dropcam HD. I was very pleased with the previous model, but had one spot where I could really take advantage of the new wider angle lens. I can say there are three situations where this cam really makes a difference over the previous model:-Places where you need a wider angle of viewingThe increase is not dramatic, but enough to cover a full area side to side better than the previous model.-Places where you need a finer color detail for differentiationThe Pro can differentiate more finely reds, grays and other colors.-Cams that are facing out windows and showing outdoor scenes.The color difference in showing outdoor scenes is significant. It went from a bit gray, to vibrant and dynamic.Setup of the cams is not difficult, and is the same as previous models. Size and shape are essentially identical, though the mounting bracket/stand is not interchangeable. I preferred the silver of the previous model and wanted to re-use it but could not.If you are buying a new dropcam, or considering replacing one for the new features, I would only choose this model if your scene fits one of the 3 categories above, or you don't know where you plan to use it. Otherwise, the Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera was more than adequate to meet my needs in other places throughout my home.Feel free to ask me any questions in comments and I will do my best to respond quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great product, but you need to buy their service to get the most out of it
Reviews.Author: Dave Pinke
Reviews.Content: I bought this dropcam after recently getting a dog and wanting to be able to watch her at work. Its been a really cool experience to use and have had lots of fun with it to. Setup was fast, its dead simple to use, you can share your feed with other people (and revoke access) easily. The app for the iPhone is great, letting you remotely turn the camera on or off, zoom and record.I'm taking one star off because they only give you one month of their CVR service which does two things. First, it backs up all your video for I think the next seven days. Second, and cooler I think, is that when it notices movement it grabs that time and gives you an alert and you can easily view all the times there was movement during the day (so you don't have to watch it all the time).For a premium product and the more expensive model, I would have hoped it would be included or at least 3-6 months of free service.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: robert engle
Reviews.Content: Great camera, wish it could be used outside I use it in the window and it's  a great  view in the day.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: DH
Reviews.Content: We are using this as a home monitoring camera to keep an eye on things while at work.  Works perfectly.  Very easy to set up and the web site has really cool time lapse and clip recording options.  I had planned on getting the $10/month 7 day recording plan, and getting the free 14 day trail with purchase of the camera has done nothing but solidify that idea.  Well worth it.We loved the dropcam pro so much that we got the Dropcam "HD" (older model) for our kids room so we can monitor what they're up to at night after we put them to bed.  This thing is so much fun and so useful.Can't think of anything I would change about it.  We use the feature that turns off alerts when you're away from your house, and for the most part it works really well.  We get the occasional false alert due to shadows from outside, but I would rather it be cautious than the alternative.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy A. Jennings
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera.  Once I set it up online via the cloud, we are adding more and just love the ease of installation and viewing.  definitely will buy again.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and clear
Reviews.Author: Moana
Reviews.Content: This replaced my Foscam cameras which required an expensive static IP address and needed constant upgrading of firmware etc.  I just installed the Dropcam in 5-10 minutes and got wide angle clear and audio without a fuss!

Reviews.Title: For the Price of the Camera, I was expecting an Un-Paralleled NEST Thermostat like device!! A big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: TechAdvisor
Reviews.Content: 1. Its one of the expensive end Camera's and the claims are almost true. For Instance 2 Way Audio Works great, Setup was easy. However the resolution is Average2. A Black Camera with a White Wire, Wire Color should be an Option during Purchase3. IPhone App is great but a reboot takes a little over 30 Seconds4. To make the usage versatile, the Camera should come with Rechargeable battery pack.5. Netgear Vue has excellent mounting option, for a camera this expensive, mounting should not be Old School technique.I am returning this camera and planning to try out Dlink Camera.

Reviews.Title: Not bad but needs a few improvements
Reviews.Author: I speak the truth
Reviews.Content: So the camera is good but a few notes , one it needs power (should have a rechargeable battery option) must be plugged in. If you want to record (well it's a camera who wouldn't?) your paying for a subscription fee $100 for the year. The camera is pretty good it's in my front window and sends movement alerts to my email. It isn't very good though at night (maybe it's the glass).

Reviews.Title: Poor Man's Security System
Reviews.Author: Chuck Speed
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the camera. I wish it was a bit cheaper to maintain the security video storage, but it still beats the price of a full security system. The picture quality is excellent and the downloads are also clear. The camera does get a bit hot, so you don't want to enclose it without some air flow. I did turn off the movement notification alerts until I am going to be out of town.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam as a Baby Monitor is AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Giovanni Farinacci
Reviews.Content: My wife and I use this as a baby monitor and we are very happy with it. The mobile apps for both IOS and Android are very well done. I researched several baby monitors and didnt like any of them, mainly because of the mobile apps and video quality. Dropcam was the best I could find for the price, quality, and ease of use. We can now review videos of our son playing alone and share them with family and friends. Our family logs in and checks in on our son too. Best investment and can be used to monitor the house when no longer needed as a baby monitor. Check out my video clip of our son after he woke up. http://youtu.be/4rseyDZYGmM

Reviews.Title: This is a great product
Reviews.Author: Laurie McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: The picture is very clear and audio very good.  We bought 2 dropcam and one was definitely a superior product that the second, as it would re-load frequently.  We returned this one and hopefully the replacement will be as good as the first.

Reviews.Title: Best security cam!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Easy setup.  Works great!  I've had another brand that was bigger and bulkier but this one is small so it is hardly noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Can't get enough of these cameras!
Reviews.Author: weatherbear
Reviews.Content: I'm addicted to these pups, the easy setup, great picture, reliable network, cloud upload etc. Yes, it costs a few bucks to save your recordings but to me it's worth it. Just wish they made an outdoor camera with the same features, they wouldn't be able to keep up with the demand. Whatcha waiting for dropcam?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alabama Man
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with excellent video quality even in low light.The wide angle viewing area is fantastic.Setup is also very easy.

Reviews.Title: Love this cam!
Reviews.Author: Bryan L.
Reviews.Content: A great alternative to costly security systems! Dropcam is nice to check on your pets as well. Great app for smartphones too.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty good...
Reviews.Author: boomquest
Reviews.Content: I first bought a Samsung Smartcam HD Pro & it was impossible to set up.  The dropcam was easy to set up & it works well.

Reviews.Title: Even better than the original Dropcam!
Reviews.Author: Stabob130
Reviews.Content: The picture on this model is noticeably better than the original Dropcam -- the resolution is really, really impressive.  Tip: works better at night when you don't have an outdoor light.  We turn our front stoop light off and it still works great (we don't love the nightvision mode).

Reviews.Title: Peace of Mind at last
Reviews.Author: Marla A Dressen
Reviews.Content: Dropcam has lived up to all expectations and delivered on all promises.  Set up was amazingly simple.  The expanded view allows me to see the whole room including doors and hallways.  And the two-way communication is the topper!  I have recommended Dropcam to anyone looking for security and peace of mind as a parent.  As soon as I need to expand my viewing to other rooms, it will be another Dropcam.  Great product!!

Reviews.Title: Packaging
Reviews.Author: Richard Marsh
Reviews.Content: I'll update my review when I've installed and used the camera, but I felt the need to compliment the way this item is shipped. I recently received a broken ceramic item as a gift (not from Amazon) and hate the way some breakable items are packaged.The box containing this camera was securely shrink-wrapped to one side of the box, such that it could not budge, either in shipping or even when I opened it. Another benefit to this is because it is secured with shrinkwrap, it is incredibly easy to remove once the box is opened. I haven't seen anything else shipped this way but if any Amazon folks look at these reviews, shipping this way is the way to go. Also, amazon should have an option to review the item purchased, and then separately review the packaging (if desired).I'll update my review once I've used the camera.

Reviews.Title: Will not stay connected to network
Reviews.Author: WS
Reviews.Content: I've had the Dropcam 'Pro' now for about 6 months.Pro:  Nice HD picture quality when it works.Con:  It will NOT stay connect to my wifi network even when the camera is positioned literally 10 feet away from my router in a direct line of sight.  It disconnects more often than not.I originally considered purchasing two of these cameras to cover different areas of the house.  I wish now that I hadn't purchased the one I have.  Looking for other alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Debbie Schlesinger
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!!! Very fast set up and has a great picture. I will order several more of these cameras!!

Reviews.Title: CCTV in HD
Reviews.Author: Lim Wan Chat
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup, view in full HD, superb night vision, motion detection with notification on real time and cloud recording

Reviews.Title: Best webcam I've ever used, but not without it's flaws
Reviews.Author: Nathan Perry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are using the Dropcam as a baby monitor. As such, it's really important for it to work continuously and without fail. For the most part the Dropcam does well. Both the phone and website cut out occasionally but I've never seen it cut out for more than a minute except once, for 4 minutes (Walked in the room, saw it blinking like it lost wireless and after a minute it started working again. I suspect a firmware update went out). The cut-outs happen pretty often, maybe once every few hours and last about a minute generally. Also, the video in the web player tends to get quite a bit of a delay after a while of viewing, up to a minute behind even though it still says "Live".The camera is somewhat sensitive to wireless interference and distance from the router. If you have trouble you may have to invest in a powerline-networking or other option to put an extension closer to the camera.There are also some limitations to the camera that are worth nothing. It will not work without an internet connection. The way the service works is the camera sends the video to the Dropcam cloud and all receivers pull the video stream from there. It's really nice that the camera kind-of 'just works', but it would be nice to have an offline option. You don't have to pay for the online services to use the camera however you will get no video history if you don't pay. The pay service has some nice features such as easily creating timelapse videos or capturing video clips but I'm not sure if I'll pay for it yet. I don't know if you can capture anything without paying for the online service but I've read you can at least view the camera for no monthly fee.Also, the Dropcam will use your internet bandwidth all the time while you are paying for the cloud service and double that when you are watching video at home. It's not a lot, but it adds up through the month so if you're on the edge of using all your cable bandwidth, this might put you over. It's a little frustrating that the camera can't broadcast on the local network for viewing without having to go online.The wi-fi on the first Dropcam we ordered died and we had to return it, but the second worked perfectly so the first one was just a lemon. Dropcam support was as helpful as they could be, but it was still very frustrating for us.None of these issues are strong enough for us to return the Dropcam, however if you have a something critical you want to watch this might not be the best option for you. Overall I think it's a wonderful piece of technology but I can't help but feel a little let down. I really love the rugged-looking and compact design as well as the picture quality but it seems like it's just not quite there yet as far as reliability goes. It's also a little frustrating that the Dropcam company seems to be really pushing the online video service and failing at offering offline services for people who just want a simple high-quality web-cam.As an alternative, there is Piper. I only read about it for a few minutes just now after noticing we website mention it but it's supposed to be no monthly fee. I don't know if it's a good alternative to Dropcam but it might be worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: Conflicted
Reviews.Author: Sean Dryden, author, Adventure-Pom! Captain H...
Reviews.Content: Great quality camera. Image quality is good and well done construction. I am conflicted about the subscription pricing though. You have to get the subscription for the camera to be of much use. It costs $99 a year. Seems expensive for what it is... But then again it's less expensive than an alarm company.If you live in a busy city, police can take anywhere from 20 minutes to several hours to respond to your house when an alarm company calls in an activation. There are so many false activations from alarms that police consider them a lower priority. With this camera, it will send your phone a notification for unusual activity. If someone is actually in your house, you can call the police yourself and confirm it is a real crime in progress. Seems more efficient to me than dealing with an alarm co.I like that the iPhone app will turn the camera on and off automatically when I come or go. It makes it easy to not have to think about it, and less likely my home life will be caught on tape!I would feel better about the subscription cost if it included more than the one camera for all the same price. They offer a discount for the service on more than one, but I'm not going to buy anymore even at a discount. An outdoor camera would also be nice.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Kevin Krebs
Reviews.Content: Cool idea, video quality is not the greatest. Playback through app on phone is limited. CVR is a great idea.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Tony drake
Reviews.Content: Terrific camera. Clear picture, real time steaming and very clear audio. Set-up is super easy and fast. The only negative is that if there's a power outage, it takes awhile for it to come back online.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam works as described
Reviews.Author: J. Hendrick
Reviews.Content: Dropcam works as described.  Dropcam is a very polished product and is packaged as good as any Apple product.  It was easy to setup - I had mine working in 10 minutes.  The only issue you may have is that you must have a good network connection in your house.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Gregory A. Brown "d800-user"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product.  I really like the field of view.  It gives us the comfort level to be able to monitor our dog while we are out of the house.

Reviews.Title: Love it little thing
Reviews.Author: Forby
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, it captures everything. I just wish it was wireless and a little smaller. The cord should be black as well, just a thought.

Reviews.Title: Easy & very useful
Reviews.Author: Britni B
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up! Great picture and great audio. We used it as camera for store, we were able to zoom in and see things closer if someone needed us to look closely at something (live). Wish we could "keep" a specific period of recording past the optional time you pay for. Great price too.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nikki S
Reviews.Content: I'm always at a loss for gifts to get my husband. He has a salt water fish tank at his office and every once and a while, a fish will die. And it's usually over the weekend or when he's not there. So I purchased the Dropcam for him he so we can keep an eye on them from home! The Dropcam is genius! I don't know how I'll ever top this gift!

Reviews.Title: SImple and exactly what i was looking for
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Super simple set up and the picture is nice and clear.  I was looking for a way to watch my living room while i was at work and after a simple set up with the camera connected to a pc you just need to unplug it and take it to where you want and plug in the power cord and its as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, easy set up
Reviews.Author: mark roudebush
Reviews.Content: The Drop Cam is great. It was up and running in minutes. It's really versatile and can be used anywhere your wifi signal will reach and it is in range of plugging in with a USB/ power connector. The product design is beautiful. The subscription service is necessary for most people I would imagine. The app and website UI's work well. One complaint I have is the location services work by triangulating your location (your phone's location) with the use of cell phone towers. This isn't accurate and can be a nuisance. Overall, this is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Drop Cam
Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: Drop Cam provides excellant video quality, however, connection had to refreshed too frequently so it became annoying.  I have moved wifi router closer (same room) and problem continued to exist.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: Sidney L. Booty
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised, couldn't be easier to install and get working! Video quality is better than I expected. Would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Bronwyn Kieland
Reviews.Content: In love with this camera. Spend the extra cash and get the pro. Once you understand the need for a upgraded wifi then all is smooth. Set up a breeze

Reviews.Title: Awesome, super easy to set up, and they work wonderfully
Reviews.Author: Victor Christianson
Reviews.Content: And the quality of the video is excellent, as is the ability to record sounds. Very highly recommended without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Stellar Product
Reviews.Author: Dean Matus
Reviews.Content: We have two dropcams and find this to be the most user friendly, best picture, and reliable camera. Best camera system we have tried and great price.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro
Reviews.Author: Sally Robertson
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Dropcam last year before going on vacation. It was great to be able to monitor my house with my iPhone. The phone prompts me when motion or sound is detected. The infrared camera is awesome. The picture quality is excellent. I have to say that this was the best $150.00 I've ever spent. I would also like to say that the customer service folks are outstanding! If you're looking for that extra bit of security then I highly recommend the Dropcam.

Reviews.Title: Ease of use.
Reviews.Author: trLitFls
Reviews.Content: The Dropcam Pro setup as advertised. I took it right out of the box,hooked it up to my computer,followed on screen instructions everything worked out. Started to monitor on the home computer to check camera, no problem. Went to work monitored no problem except I have IE8 at work(and cannot be changed unless done by administration for security reasons) The monitoring worked/sound but some options like zoom do not come up on IE8. so if you like to monitor from work check you have at least Explorer8. The company administrator downloaded Google Chrome,all monitoring worked perfect then stopped and freezed(after company patch-so no fault of Google or Dropcam,Chrome needs update).If you use computer at work be wary of the browser. Did not test Android app yet as phones are banned within plant.One other note,the night vision is sensitive so you may have to reposition the camera away from shiny objects(glass,etc)as it seems to blacken the dept so objects in the background may not show up(think sitting under a lamp and looking in a dark room)

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Aaron Barker
Reviews.Content: Worked exactly as expected. Easy setup and clear instructions. Love the online viewing and DVR features. Would for sure purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, waiting for the exterior rated camera for additional security.
Reviews.Author: Loren Ness
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this product for video monitoring of a remote place. The cloud recording option is invaluable, as two people I know have had their homes burglarized, only to find the burglars took the surveillance video equipment too, so no video evidence of the intruders!

Reviews.Title: DropCam and Elder Care
Reviews.Author: Carol gilbert
Reviews.Content: I purchased DropCam to help me monitor my 99 year old father's daily activities.  I live 3,000 miles away from him and this fantastic tool lets me "drop in" and visit with him 24/7.  Recently I participated in a visiting nurse home visit.  The video is clear and I can look back to see if he had any problems during the night.  Because my dad is hard of hearing we really haven't been able to use the sound component...instead I call him on the phone when I would like to speak to him.  I am so glad I purchased this device.

Reviews.Title: CVR Subscribtion not for the WORLD !
Reviews.Author: Khaled
Reviews.Content: the camera itself is amazing and the setup and configuration are too simple. but CVR supscribtion is not available outside U.S and CANADA. Why is that ?? the language of money doesn't know a country. it should be available across the globe. i wasn't aware of this when i purchased my 3 pieces of this camera

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro
Reviews.Author: RONALD ERICKSON
Reviews.Content: Nice easy set up. Works great. Really love being able to check on things from anywhere in a pc or my phone.

Reviews.Title: Dropcam Pro Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera
Reviews.Author: Jim Tice
Reviews.Content: The very best of all the security cameras.one two three four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen to fulfill required number of words.

Reviews.Title: Totally Amazing .  Ordering more of them , to make my life easier ..
Reviews.Author: Dr Metal . MD
Reviews.Content: I'm the care provider for my 90 year old Mother , who suffers from dementia ..  I bought one unit , and placed it in the living room where she sits ..
